intro: Pedicularis cephalanthoides, commonly known as the helmeted lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive helmet-shaped flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
